intro: Satureja tenuis, commonly known as narrowleaf savory, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by aromatic leaves and square stems. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring small, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in whorls along the stem, and it produces small, spherical fruits. Satureja tenuis is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its aromatic properties.
